What is a Platform?

Outline (What is a Platform?)

  1. What is a Platform? [4]
  2. Four Platform Functions [4]
  3. What's Different About Governments? [5]
  4. Conclusions [2]
What is a Platform? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(3) Modern Monopolies



What is a Platform? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(4) Platform Business Models

  • Internal platforms are for improving effectiveness
    • Car platforms have revolutionized car design and production
    • Service platforms allow companies to move faster and with more flexibility
  • Open platforms are for creating new business models
    • Orchestrate value exchanges and figure out a way for value generation
    • Platform scale is essential to make (most) business models work


What is a Platform? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(5) Linear Organizations: No Co-Creation



What is a Platform? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(6) Platforms: Co-Creation as Outsourced Production/Innovation



Four Platform Functions

Outline (Four Platform Functions)

  1. What is a Platform? [4]
  2. Four Platform Functions [4]
  3. What's Different About Governments? [5]
  4. Conclusions [2]
Four Platform Functions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(8) Audience Building

  • Platforms are built around the idea of scaling up
    • Producers need to be contributing value that's available for consumption
    • Consumers are attracted by available products and fuel value generation
  • Government as a Platform should focus on building communities


Four Platform Functions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(9) Matchmaking

  • Good platforms focus on minimizing transaction friction
    • Growth [Audience Building (1)] means that navigating the platform must scale
    • Managing inventory (a catalog) and making it available (a portal) are key ingredients
  • Government as a Platform should focus on connecting community members


Four Platform Functions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(10) Supporting Transactions

  • Having a plan how to support and drive the main transactions
    • Tools are self-service mechanisms for platform users
    • Services as safety mechanisms beyond automated tools
  • Government as a Platform should make it easy to participate


Four Platform Functions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(11) Creating a Safe Environment

  • Rules and regulations that make the platform safe to use
    • Producers need to follow the rules or they get banned
    • Consumers can have some level of trust in the platform
  • Government as a Platform should make it safe to participate


What's Different About Governments?

Outline (What's Different About Governments?)

  1. What is a Platform? [4]
  2. Four Platform Functions [4]
  3. What's Different About Governments? [5]
  4. Conclusions [2]
What's Different About Governments? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(13) Federated by Definition

  • Governments are always federated
    • Agencies: Different agencies operate independently
    • Federated agencies: Agencies at different levels operate independently
    • International cooperation: Governments may participate in international efforts
  • Federation needs an additional layer of cataloging above the technical management


What's Different About Governments? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(14) Natural Monopolies

  • No competition for market share
  • Should be required to be open in the general anti-trust spirit


What's Different About Governments? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(15) Tricky Value Definitions

  • What is a definition of done for government agencies?
  • Local optimization ignores monopoly [Natural Monopolies (1)] issues
  • Agency optimization ignores federation [Federated by Definition (1)] issues


What's Different About Governments? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(16) Cooperation

  • Government services always should be considered to be building blocks
  • Aligning agencies is notoriously difficult
    • Platforms provide reusable building blocks
    • Platforms allow co-creation


What's Different About Governments? Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(17) Innovation

  • Governments should do as little as they can
    • Very open to scope but holds true for any non-1984 world view
  • Citizens should be able to use the services that they're funding
    • Any service should show up in some API (service, reporting, funding, …)


Conclusions

Outline (Conclusions)

  1. What is a Platform? [4]
  2. Four Platform Functions [4]
  3. What's Different About Governments? [5]
  4. Conclusions [2]
Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform

(19) Just like the platform economy…?

  • Almost, but there are some differences
    • There are fewer differences than most agencies tend to think
    • Platform economy is a model that can be tweaked and tuned
  • Understanding platforms to improve the government
    • Cultivate a customer mindset
    • Customers are anybody using the platform (citizens and co-creators)


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Government as a Platform
